arm_group.description: Patients who develop a rapid cycling course during the follow-up period.
Patients who do not develop a rapid cycling course during the follow-up period.

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study we tried to elucidate the factors associated with the development of a rapid
      cycling course in bipolar disorder patients, in a prospective and longitudinal design, and
      the role of antidepressants. The identification of risk factors is extremely relevant from
      the clinical point of view. We hypothesized that rapid cycling bipolar disorder is
      associated with more chronicity, poor outcome, and more antidepressant prescription.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors for Development of Rapid Cycling in Bipolar Disorder Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Bipolar I and II disorder patients according to DSM-IV criteria

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Major medical comorbidities, voluntary drop-out from study

study_pop.textblock: Bipolar I and II disorder patients

facility.name: Barcelona Bipolar Disorders Program, Hospital Clinic Barcelona

clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors for Development of Rapid Cycling in Bipolar Disorder Patients

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who develop rapid cycling
